articles.author: Jim Teece
articles.description:
12/23/2025 Business Oregon is accepting applications for the Industrial Development Bond (IDB) program, a key financing tool designed to help Oregon manufacturers, processors, exempt facilities, and nonprofits grow, create jobs, and strengthen the state’s traded-sector economy. Oregon Industrial Development Bonds are tax-exempt revenue bonds issued by the state of Oregon that provide long-term financing for land, buildings,…
The post Application Process Open for Industrial Development Bond Program to Support Oregon Manufacturers appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.
articles.title: Application Process Open for Industrial Development Bond Program to Support Oregon Manufacturers

articles.author: Jim Teece
articles.description:
MEDFORD, OR – December 23, 2025 – In a move set to redefine the Southern Oregon development landscape, three of the Rogue Valley’s most prominent professional services firms have finalized a major merger. CSA Planning, CEC Engineering, and Marquez and Associates have officially joined forces with AKS Engineering and Forestry LLC, creating a regional titan…
The post Regional Engineering Powerhouse Formed via Triple-Merger of Rogue Valley Firms appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.
articles.title: Regional Engineering Powerhouse Formed via Triple-Merger of Rogue Valley Firms

articles.author: Jim Teece
articles.description:
ASHLAND/PHOENIX, OR — Kimo and Mim, the longtime owners of the iconic Puck’s Donuts, have officially announced their retirement effective January 1, 2026. After nearly three decades of ownership, the couple will pass the torch to their daughter, Vilay, and her partner, Nicholas, ensuring the family-run business remains a staple of the Southern Oregon community.…
The post Puck’s Donuts Owners Announce Retirement; 50-Year Legacy to Continue with Next Generation appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.
articles.title: Puck’s Donuts Owners Announce Retirement; 50-Year Legacy to Continue with Next Generation

articles.author: Jim Teece
articles.description:
ASHLAND, OR — In the shifting landscape of American retail, the “Experience Economy” has moved from a buzzword to a survival strategy. While many brick-and-mortar shops struggle against digital disruption, The Websters, a premier fiber arts destination in Ashland, is rewriting the script. Their model for the March 2026 Retreat provides a masterclass in how…
The post The Masterpiece Strategy: How The Websters Transformed Boutique Retail into a Global Destination appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.
articles.title: The Masterpiece Strategy: How The Websters Transformed Boutique Retail into a Global Destination

articles.description: Roseburg police captured a man wanted for a violent robbery and assault after a dramatic escape attempt on Saturday.
articles.title: Roseburg man jumps from moving car to escape, caught by police

articles.author: News Staff
articles.description: Roseburg Schools is inviting community members to join a new Community Facilities Advisory Committee. This group will help assess the condition of aging school buildings and explore long-term facility needs.
articles.title: Roseburg Schools calls on community for facilities committee input
